text: hi
everyone here the internet's busiest
music nerd and it's time for a review of
this new slous and Malone one project
excelsor new project from California
music producer composer songwriter
multi-instrumentalist slon Malone a
versatile artist whose first album back
in 2019 was one of the most mindbending
musical experiences I had that year the
way he somehow made abstract hipop po
sound collages ambient music and
acoustic touches work together in
harmony it was just something to behold
he even flirted with more folky and pop
Aesthetics on the EP he followed that up
with the next year in a very short
amount of time Malone or Jasper
Armstrong marceles son of trumpet player
Winton marceles was for me one of the
most exciting and promising young
producers out there but the funny thing
is even though I was excited for this
project I had no earthly idea as to what
it would sound like where it would go
because I think assuming that Malone
would go into this project working with
pretty much the same hip-hop flavors he
did on his first record that that would
be foolish nor did I think he'd snugly
fall in line with the tradition of
electronic music that warp records is
known for and even the handful of
teasers we heard before this record came
out covered some unexpected bases New
Joy for example was this really vague
Moody indie rock pasti with a lot of
Reverb on it some understated vocals and
very crunchy guitars kind of sounds like
several things from back in the day that
I kind of lost memory of because they
weren't that standout I'm really more
enamored with The Surreal effects that
surround uh the song than the song
itself there was also halflife which
sounds like the sad dejected guitar
musings of a UK singer songwriter along
the lines of Archie Marshall King kruel
though not quite as bold sadly then
there's also Voyager which I think has a
Vibe similar to halflife but also hits
with all these subtle psychedelic Sonics
glitches in The Matrix popping up almost
at random mind you they do fit into the
groove of the song overall but they also
come on so quickly and don't last very
long like in one moment where there's
suddenly a horn section and the song
kind of ends out of nowhere because of
course it does when you listen to this
LP you learn very quickly that slous and
Malone is not dictated by a bias toward
traditional song structures and maybe
here is where I'll merge into one of my
Prime complaints with this project that
there's so little cohesion and
development on key moments of excelsor
as in the track list of this project
slon is Conjuring up a lot of
interesting snapshots and sketches Great
Sound pallets like on the spooky opener
the weather which sounds like an early
version of Animal Collective performing
a Satanic ritual then there's also house
music which feels like if you took the
same song and flipped it into an
experimental glitchy beat music piece
meanwhile under Commons is this loose
lazy Waltz whose Bas and keys kind of
melt before your ears that is before
they turn into a Twin Peak style
nightmare with More instrumental and
vocal layers blossoming on the following
track old joy and that's one thing I can
give slous and Malone even if there's
not a lot of super detailed development
on many of these tracks on an individual
level there is a reinforcement going on
between some of the songs here clear
Segways or compositional connections one
piece will move on but carry maybe a
little bit of the previous track with it
and change that into something else like
the opening keyboard Melodies on Voyager
and how they borrow from a piano Melody
on the previous track Destroyer ex or
even in the way some of the vocal
harmonies and Melodies on Voyager uh get
used in a different context on
Challenger more than a track later
during interestingly self-referential
moments like these I think is where the
record is really at its best makes the
album feel kind of like a puzzle block
that I'm slowly figuring out pulling
apart and keep in mind even though I've
given this record quite a few listens
through at this point and feel confident
enough to review it and say what I do
and don't like about it there are most
likely still aspects of this album and
uh weird hidden Easter eggs and layers
that I haven't even picked up on yet I
mean as of this moment admittedly I feel
like I've barely scratched the surface
of some of the lyrics here a lot of them
at first glance read as very absurd
maybe even silly but this just may be a
means of covering up uh various
throughways and kind of like back roads
that uh connect various parts of this
record on a lyrical level too but as I
was getting to earlier there are quite a
few songs on this thing that are not
super long or well-developed musically
so it helps quite a bit to feel like
there are numerous moments across the
album uh that segue into each other
reinforce each other so even if a track
is short there is some kind of like
connection to the next moment a momentum
that was built up during one track is
kind of carried over into the next but
even though this is a great aspect of
the album uh it's not always consistent
some of the tracks here no matter how
much I revisit them just kind of feel
like random detours or flashes in the
pan be it with a glitchy orchestral
freakout a whispered spoken word piece
or maybe even an overly long drum roll
and look some of that stuff is here
because this record is experimental
legitimately experimental but I think
excelsor reminds me that something being
experimental doesn't necessarily mean it
has to feel unfocused and look to this
album's credit there are some moments
that slaon actually builds up into what
feels like a fully fledged song be that
on I hear a new world which sounds like
one of the kookier ballads from Zappa's
freakout era uh for example but if it
were meant to be a lullabi uh that's
supposed to turn violent mental patients
to sleep there's also no uh Gyer dub
which is a Spacey Bas synth backed
reggae cut that feels like a lost psych
Fusion gem from the 70s which I know
hearing me say that sounds like like it
makes no sense but once you hear it
you'll know what the hell I'm talking
about and even Voyager uh which has its
moments I wish lasted a bit longer uh
does sound better shoulder-to-shoulder
with other tracks on the record that
reinforce it build up to it borrow from
it and develop further and generally I
will say the cohesion track to trck on
this LP is a lot better and clearer in
the second half than it is the first and
I think slaon in a funny way Nails the
landing on the record too with the very
short us Tower of love which is this
beautiful ascending acoustic piece with
a building strings over it and it
unfolds in a way Pace wise that feels
like it should be really beautiful and
elegant but as it progresses uh the
instrumentation gets more sloppy and
dissonant and hideous it's kind of this
very silly rug pull at the very end of
the album uh that not only shows off
slous and Malone's compositional chop
but also you know that that he just has
a sense of humor about what he does
still though that doesn't change the
fact that there are some tracks there
are some moments uh that I wish lasted
longer that I wish uh segwayed into each
other in a more clear and sensible way
some of the tracks that have more of a
straightforward indie rock pallet in my
opinion uh do run a bit plain but with
all of that being said I found the vast
majority of this project to be
intriguing to be moving to be highly
replayable I mean really an onion that
you can continue to pull layers back on
over and over and over forever and even
if this is not my favorite project
Malone has done so far I still think
this record confirms that the talent
that was so obviously there on the first
record uh was not a fluke and that
marcelis is in fact a boundary pushing
producer who really could just be at the
start of what may very well be a long
and exciting career I'm feeling a light
to decent 7 on this one TR have you
given this record a listen did you love
it did you hate it what would you rate
it you're the best you're the best what
should I review next hit the like if you
like Please Subscribe and please don't
cry hit the Bell as well over here next
to my head is another video you can
check out hit that up or the link to
subscribe to the channel Anthony fantano
SL Malone of forever
